intro: Rubus peguericus, commonly known as the Mexican blackberry, is a species of brambles native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and aggregate fruits. The plant produces dark purple to black berries that are typically small and tart. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
